High RS values indicate high performance of GCMs. The total RS for each GCM for a specific climate variable was obtained by summing all RS for all criteria used. In this study, a weight of 0.5 was allocated to the criteria including trend analysis, trend magnitude, the first two leading modes of each empirical orthogonal function (EOF1 and EOF2), and two PDF (probability density function) criteria, namely BS (brier score) and S score (significance score), while the other assessment criteria had a 1.0 weight in the summation. This total RS was then used to rank the GCMs for all climate variables [ 42]. Eleven statistics used in this study are shown in Table 1.
